nodes.text: 'WT1 has been conserved throughout vertebrate evolution, although only mammals possess numerous protein isoforms.' (Nucleic Acids Research, 2003, Vol. 31, No. 11 2795-2802, Faithful expression of a tagged Fugu WT1 protein from a genomic transgene in zebrafish: efficient splicing of pufferfish genes in zebrafish but not mice)
So it has gone from an indeterminate (based on my quick searches) number of fewer isoforms in lower vertebrates to the 24 found in mammals. That's an increase in information.
